content.title: Central PMS team
content.visibleText:
Travis King

I'd like to use the quarterly budget conversation to bubble up the issues you have seen when talking with our customer base, or thereover not talking as they ignore us or have different agendas

what would you add?

Ben New

I agree with Travis's approach. It's important to highlight the issues we face with our customers directly in these budget discussions. This way, we can address them more effectively and ensure that they are not overlooked.

George D'Souza

I think it's important to discuss the specific issues we've encountered with certain customers. This includes both the problems we've faced and the successes we've had. It's crucial to provide a balanced view to our management.

Lebouef Hélène

I believe it's essential to bring up the challenges we face with customer engagement. Many times, customers are not responsive or are difficult to reach. Highlighting these challenges can help us strategize better ways to engage them.

Thibault Brisebois

It's also important to mention the positive aspects of our interactions with customers. While there are challenges, there are also significant successes that should be highlighted.

THEM ABAB

I think it's crucial to discuss how we can improve our customer interactions. This includes discussing potential strategies for better engagement and addressing any issues that have arisen.

Thibault Brisebois

I will finish with a call and add my insights by the time of our call

George D'Souza

For Cplink, there is also the fact that [the text is cut off]

content.title: Jive CoPilot - Educational Series Part 1
content.visibleText:
Hello | First name |

We are now starting to send educational videos to better address the concerns you have about PCI. We appreciate and value these interactions with you and want to get real-world insights everyone else can also benefit from this knowledge.

Today's video is about how we ensure your data is secure and PCI compliant. Understandably, there were questions regarding data security, and we want to address these concerns even more explicitly in our communications.

Watch the video below to learn more about our commitment to keeping your data secure and ensuring PCI is being observed on your data.

How does CoPilot work?

4. Filtered articles are sent into ChangeIT with user's question, and gets an answer

windows.title: DevFactory Mail - Pinned - High memory usage - 2.2 GB - Google Chrome - Firat (trilogy.com)

uiElements.details: address bar, bookmarks bar, tabs bar, vertical scrollbar, horizontal scrollbar

content.title: Email Content
content.visibleText:
Customer Focus / Product Management
We believe that the customer interaction dynamics are very different between newly acquired companies and companies that have been in the portfolio for years, with the former more likely to engage and the latter unlikely to engage. And this lead to creating two different service flavors:

New Acquisitions (e.g., Tivan, Intuitive)

We want to leverage the curiosity and willingness of new customers to engage and participate, thus establishing a more productive relationship from the beginning. We aim to follow a 4 stage framework:
- Establish engagement
- Help define a structured process that takes under two weeks and that experiences a focus group of engaged customers. PMs will focus on those customers and the rest of the customers will be in BU’s responsibility if non-responsive or not interested
- Understanding insights
- Internal fields are dedicated to engaging with the customer base to understand their needs and gather valuable insights. The insights will serve not only the current projects, but will overall improve our understanding of the customer base and their challenges.
- Selling the value
- Before building the product we will validate the project idea by presenting it to customers and collecting feedback that will drive further iterations. As often as possible, we will use CNU to create fast, simple, focused POCs that can help in this process.
- Building
- Involves building the solution into the product. Note: that is not to say that development is blocked in the meanwhile; work can in most cases start ahead of time.

Old Acquisitions

Our expectations in terms of getting customer engagement are not high for these products. Here we will adopt a fail-fast strategy where if the engagement efforts fail, we will take the details back to the business and the product team to decide how that impacts the product plans.

tabs, address bar, bookmarks bar, and Gmail interface with navigation pane, chat section, and main email content area.

content.title: Email Content
content.visibleText:
Subject: Central PMS team

What I have for now in Q1 is

For ChitLink, there is also the fact that communication managers are used to first hearing about a feature and creating internal guides for their teams. This means they want to feel 'handled' when they are doing first, and only focus on other stuff when they have time (in this case, ChitLink is not a priority for them, and they said this multiple times).

Dragos Nuta

Who are those comms managers?

Also, from some customers, I've heard them saying 'we've told this multiple times to others at your company,' which states that they have been negative before (can also say that they are hesitant in engaging new conversations, as they have lost their concerns or have been addressed), so they feel no disruption in emails and forms, but they are quite upset if it turns out in person, and would like to get response to their old concerns before hearing about new relevant new features.
